incidents.name: New Relic UI Delays and Irregularities in the EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 14:55 UTC and 20:38 UTC on May 5th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced the APM UI returning errors or not loading as expected. Data ingest and alert notifications were not impacted.

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: Alerts UI Irregularities

incident_updates.body:
Between 13:00 UTC on March 6th and 20:00 UTC on March 7th, some customers in the US region may have intermittently experienced out-of-date views for dashboards and UIs which rely on entity tags. Existing alert notifications were not impacted; however, some customers may have been unable to edit or view alert conditions related to entity tags.

We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.
We are continuing to investigate an issue with entity tag processing. Updates will be provided upon significant change in status.

We are continuing to investigate an issue with entity tag processing. Some customers in the US region may experience out-of-date views for dashboards and UIs which rely on entity tags. Existing alert notifications are functioning as expected; however, some customers may be unable to edit or view alert conditions related to entity tags.

We are investigating an issue with entity tag processing. Some customers in the US region may experience out-of-date views for dashboards and UIs which rely on entity tags. Existing alert notifications are functioning as expected; however, some customers may be unable to edit or view alert conditions related to entity tags.
Some customers in the US region may experience issues when using the using filters in the Alerts UI. Alerts notifications are not affected.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: NRQL Query Errors in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 16:15 UTC and 17:25 UTC on February 23rd, some customers in the US region may have experienced errors when running NRQL queries or when accessing reports or parts of the New Relic UI.

We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alert Delays in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 15:30 UTC and 17:52 UTC on February 13th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delayed or false alert notifications for all data types.
 
We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.
We are seeing some recovery for impacted services and are monitoring for stability. Some customers in the US region may see improved alert notification performance at this time.
We are continuing to investigate alert processing latency contributing to some customers in the US region experiencing delayed or false alert notifications for all data types.
We are investigating alert processing latency contributing to some US customers experiencing delayed or false alert notifications for all data types.
Some customers in the US region may experience delayed alert notifications for all data types.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incidents.name: Login and UI Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 15:55 UTC and 16:22 UTC on January 30th, some customers in the US region may have experienced errors during login and intermittent permissions or account-related errors when navigating the UI. 

We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.

affected_components.name: UI : US - Auto-Telemetry with Pixie : US
UI : US - AWS Lambda Integration : US

incident_updates.body:
We are continuing to investigate issues contributing to login and UI errors. Some customers in the US region may experience errors when attempting to login and intermittent permissions or account-related errors when navigating the UI. 

We are seeing recovery for affected services at this time and will continue to provide updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Entity Data Delayed for US/EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 11:50 UTC - 13:24 UTC on January 24th, some customers in the US and EU regions may have experienced a delay in the display of data for new Entities reporting data to New Relic for the first time.
We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incidents.name: Azure Integrations Data and Alerts Missing or Delayed in US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body:
Between 01:00 UTC and 08:00 UTC on January 21st, some customers in the US and EU regions may have experienced missing or delayed infra-metrics for Azure integrations as well as delayed or missing alert notifications for related data. 

To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false positive alert notifications, notifications for affected data were temporarily suppressed during this time.

incidents.name: Alerts Irregularities in the EU Region

incident_updates.body: Between 08:23 UTC and 13:44 UTC on January 11th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed, false-positive, or missing alert notifications for all alertable data types. We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Data and Alert Delays in the US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 19:17 UTC and 20:37 UTC on January 8th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delays for multiple data types in queries, charts, and dashboards as well as delayed or missing alert notifications for related data. 

To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false positive alert notifications, notifications for affected data were temporarily suppressed during this time.

incidents.name: Data Irregularities in the EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 15:23 UTC and 22:07 UTC on December 5th, some customers in the EU region may have experienced errors when sending data to New Relic, issues viewing real time data, and delayed or missing alert notifications related to real time data. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false positive alert notifications, we temporarily suppressed notifications for affected data intermittently during this timeframe. 

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incident_updates.body:
Our teams are continuing to investigate issues with data ingest for multiple data types. Some customers in the EU region may experience intermittent errors when sending data to New Relic, issues viewing real time data, and delayed or missing alert notifications related to real time data. 

We are seeing recovery of affected services at this time and have disabled alert notification suppression as a result. We're monitoring as services recover and will provide an additional update once we've fully validated that all affected services have returned to normal operation.

Some customers in the EU region may continue to experience errors when sending infrastructure data to New Relic, issues viewing real time infrastructure data, and delayed or missing alert notifications related to real time infrastructure data. incidents.name: Browser Data and Alert Irregularities in the US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 18:04 UTC and 18:20 UTC and again from 19:04 UTC to 19:36 UTC on October 18th, some customers in the US regions may have experienced delayed browser data in queries, charts, and dashboards as well as delayed or missing alert notifications for related data. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false positive alert notifications, notifications for affected data were temporarily suppressed between 19:49 UTC and 20:01 UTC. 
 
We have investigated and resolved this interruption and the above services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alert Irregularities in US and EU Regions

incident_updates.body: Between 17:48 UTC and 22:27 UTC on Monday, September 11, 2023, some customers in the US and EU region may have experienced missing alert notifications and errors accessing the Alerts UI. We have investigated and resolved a service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.
Alert notifications and errors in the UI are recovering. We will notify once all services have completely returned to normal operation.
New Relic is continuing to work to restore services to normal operation.
New Relic is continuing to work to restore services to normal operation.
New Relic is continuing to work to restore services to normal operation.
New Relic has concluded the investigation with our cloud provider and are now working and investigating on how to return our services back to normal operation.
New Relic teams are continuing to investigate the issue with our cloud provider.

New Relic teams are continuing to investigate this issue with our cloud provider. We have identified the root cause and are working to resolve the issue. 

Customers in the US and EU region may be experiencing issues accessing various portions of the New Relic UI and missing alert notifications. Data ingest does not appear to be impacted at this time

We are investigating an issue impacting alerting. Some customers in the US and EU regions may experience missing alert notifications for all data sources. Additionally customers may experience errors accessing the Alerts UI.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Data Ingest and Alert Delays in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 02:03 UTC and 05:45 UTC on Wednesday, September 6, 2023, some customers in the US region may have experienced an impact to data collection and delayed or missing alert notifications.To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false-positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 02:20 UTC and 04:52 UTC.

We have investigated and resolved a service interruption with our Cloud Service Provider and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incidents.name: Alert Delays in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between approximately 14:30 UTC on August 26th and 03:59 UTC on August 27th, some customers in the US region may have experienced missing, delayed, or false alert notifications.

We investigated and resolved this interruption. Impacted services have returned to normal operation.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work toward resolution on this issue.
We are continuing to work toward resolution on this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Some customers in the US region may be experiencing delayed or missing alert notifications, as well as intermittent false positive alerts.
We are still actively engaged on this issue. Our teams have scaled the system and tried to reduce traffic where appropriate, as well as implemented additional targeted monitoring to assist with the investigation.
We are still investigating this interruption. Some customers in the US region may be experiencing delayed or missing alert notifications, as well as intermittent false positive alerts.

We are continuing to investigate an issue with alerts. Some customers in the US region may be experiencing delayed or missing alert notifications, as well as intermittent false positive alerts.

incidents.name: Alert Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 16:51 UTC and 17:21 UTC on August 18th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delayed or missing alert notifications for all data sources.To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false-positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 16:58 UTC and 17:21 UTC.

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

We're seeing some improvement for alert notifications and are continuing to monitor as impacted services recover. Some customers may continue to experience some delayed or missing alert notifications as services return to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alert Delays for the US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 02:21 UTC and 03:47 UTC on August 17th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delay or dropped alerts for alert notifications, and possible delays in distributed trace data. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false-positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 02:55 UTC and 03:49UTC.

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating an issue that may impact Alerts for customer accounts in the US region.

incidents.name: Synthetics Delays in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 15:05 UTC and 16:55 UTC on August 11th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delays for synthetics checks results and delayed or missing synthetics-related alert notifications.

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.
We are continuing to investigate latency in the synthetics processing pipeline contributing to delayed synthetics check results and related alert notifications.
Some customers in the US region may experience delays for synthetics checks results and delayed or missing synthetics-related alert notifications.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Data Ingest US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 10:29 UTC and 11:30 UTC on August 11th, 2023, some customers in the US region may have experienced 503 errors when sending data to New Relic. We resolved an issue with data ingest and impacted services have returned to normal operation. Alert notifications during these times may be missing or delayed.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

We have investigated and resolved this issue and the above services have returned to normal operation.

incidents.name: Alerts Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 20:15 UTC and 22:10 UTC on July 13th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delayed time-to-glass and delayed or missing alert notifications for the following data types: metric timeslice, mobile trace, browser trace, synthetics, Lambda errors, and AWS X-Ray traces. Impacted customers may have experienced drops in ingested data for mobile and browser data types. 

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operation.

We have identified and corrected an issue with our data streaming platform which caused some customers in the US region to experience delayed or missing alert notification related to the following data types: metric timeslice, mobile trace, browser trace, synthetics, Lambda errors, and AWS X-Ray traces. Customers may see recovery of affected services at this time. We are continuing to monitor these services to ensure a complete recovery.

Some customers in the US region may experience delayed or missing alert notifications related to metric timeslice, mobile trace, browser trace, and synthetics data. Some customers may also experience data drops for Lambda error data. We are continuing to investigate this issue and will provide updates as they become available.

Some customers in the US region may experience delayed or missing alert notifications related to metric timeslice, mobile trace, browser trace, and synthetics data. We are investigating this issue and will provide updates as they become available.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Alerts & AI Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 22:02 UTC July 10th and 00:42 UTC July 11th, some customers in the US region may have experienced alert violations not opening and closing as expected, leading to delayed or missing alert notifications. We've resolved this service interruption and affected services have returned to normal operation.

Customers in the US region may notice recovery for affected services at this time. We're continuing to monitor as services return to normal operation and will continue to provide updates as they become available.

Some customers in the US region may experience alert violations and incidents intermittently failing to open or close as expected. Impacted customers may additionally experience missing alert notifications. We're investigating and will provide updates as they become available.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Data delay for APM, Mobile, and Browser

incident_updates.body: Between 19:59 UTC and 21:25 UTC on June 18th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delays for APM, Mobile, and Browser data. Alert notifications may have also been impacted for some customers.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating an issue that may cause delays for APM, Mobile, and Browser data visibility within the US region. Alert notifications may also be impacted for some customers.

incidents.name: Data Ingest delays for EU Region

incident_updates.body:
Between 23:30 UTC June 17 and 00:20 UTC June 18, some customers in the EU region may have experienced data ingest delays for all features. 

We have investigated and resolved this service interruption and impacted services have returned to normal operations.

incidents.name: Alert Notification Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 16:03 UTC - 16:33 UTC, some customers in the US region may have experienced missing alert notifications and errors when navigating the Alert Conditions & Policies UI. We have identified and reverted a contributing network change which has resolved the service interruption. Affected products have returned to their normal operation.

We've identified and reverted a contributing network configuration update causing some customers in the US region to experience missing alert notifications and errors when viewing the Alert Conditions & Policies UI. Customers may be seeing recovery at this time. We are continuing to monitor the performance of impacted services.

Some customers in the US region may be experiencing missing alert notifications and errors when navigating to the Alerts Conditions & Policies UI. Customers may begin seeing recovery of affected services at this time.
Some customers in the US region may be experiencing missing alert notifications. We are investigating and will provide updates as they become available.
We are investigating a potential service interruption that may impact some customers. Please continue to monitor this page for updates.

incidents.name: Browser and Mobile Data Irregularities in EU Region

incident_updates.body: Between 14:49 and 15:06 UTC on May 23rd, some customers in the EU region may have experienced delayed data in charts and dashboards for several browser and mobile data sources including JavaScriptErrors, BrowserInteraction, AjaxRequest, BrowserTiming, PageViewTiming, and PageAction events. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false-positive alert notifications for related data types during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers between 14:59 and 15:06 UTC.

affected_components.name: Data Ingest : Europe - Browser Agent : Europe

incidents.name: Alert Irregularities in US Region

incident_updates.body: Between 21:55 UTC and 22:25 UTC on May 18th, some customers in the US region may have experienced delays for telemetry data and related alert notifications. To prevent our customers from receiving a high volume of false-positive alert notifications during this interruption, alerts were temporarily suppressed for applicable customers during this window.
Some customers in the US region may experience delayed telemetry data and delayed or missing alert notifications.
